results.title: Brazil
results.creator_credit: Embassy International Pictures, Arnon Milchan and Terry Gilliam
results.brief_description: This nightmarish futuristic satire effectively blurs all lines between illusion and reality. Sam Lowrey, an unambitious government statistician, chooses to ignore the decaying drone-like world around him. Whenever real life becomes too oppressive, Sam fantasizes about being a superhero forever rescuing beautiful Jill Layton. When the omnipresent computer that controls everything in the “real” world malfunctions it causes the mistaken-identity assassination of an innocent citizen. When Sam routinely investigates the error, he meets Jill, literally the girl of his dreams. It turns out, however, that she is an associate of a terrorist whom the computer had originally intended to target for execution. Cast includes: Jonathan Pryce, Michael Palin, Kim Greist, Katherine Helmond, Ian Holm, Bob Hoskins and Robert De Niro.

results.title: Bravery in the field
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Roman Kroitor, Stefan Wodoslawsky and Giles Walker
results.brief_description: Tommy is a veteran of World War II. He rooms alone, waiting for his pension cheque to arrive, passing the time in the evenings with his cronies in the Legion Hall. Lennie can claim only a third of Tommy’s years, but he prowls the same area of town, and, surprisingly enough, they have more in common than either of them realises. Bravery in the Field portrays the frustration’s and hostilities of these two men whose lives lack a sense of place and purpose. This dramatised story occurs early in November and leads up to an event that provides one of Tommy’s few remaining moments of glory: the annual veterans’ Remembrance Day parade. Stars Les Rubie and Matt Craven. (Awards: Toronto)

results.title: Braverman's condensed cream of Beatles
results.brief_description: A history of the Beatles and the 1960’s from the exuberant, youthful days to the socially conscious end of the decade. Kinestatic imagery captures the Beatles in concert, being interviewed, appearing in news reports interspersed with art, collages, animation, photographs and scenes of social and political activity. Excerpts from their films are also effectively intercut, presenting the spirit of the Beatles, the spirit of the times and the lasting imprint on life and culture made by this remarkable group of musicians. (Awards: Atlanta)

results.title: Brave Kate
results.brief_description: A violent puppet animated treatment of a 19th century Czech song in which Kate sets out to avenge the murder of her father. Displaying trmendous courage and resourcefulness she tracks the murderes and eliminates them one by one. Animated by Vlasta Pospisilova, Xenie Maresova and Alfons Mensdorff-Pouilly.

results.title: Brave Irene
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios, Paul R. Gagne and Daniel Ivanick
results.brief_description: Irene’s mother is a seamstress who has been chosen to make a dress for the Duchess to wear to the big ball. When her mother gets sick, Irene decides to take the dress to the duchess herself. On the way there it begins to snow, but Irene is determined to reach the palace before the ball. Narrated by Lindsay Crouse. Based on the book by William Steig.

results.title: Brave banners
results.brief_description: Traces the origin and use of flags and heraldry in such diverse situations as Nelson’s historic signal and the unfurling of the Stars and Stripes on the moon. Concludes with the history and development of the Australian flag.

results.title: Brass
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Harry Rapf and Sidney A. Franklin
results.brief_description: Philip Baldwin (Monte Blue) is the son of a prosperous fruit-farmer. His marriage to Rosemary, daughter of his father’s best friend has been planned since they were children, but when gold-digging city girl Marjorie (Marie Prevost) finds work during the summer vacation at the ranch, she seduces Philip into marriage. Domestic problems, city living and friction with his mother-in-law contribute to Marjorie divorcing Philip and abandoning their son. Philip then discovers true love with Mrs Grotenberg (Irene Rich) the widow who boards with the family and cares for the child. Cast also includes Harry Meyers, Frank Keenan and Harvey Clark. Based on the novel by Charles G. Norris.

results.title: Branding
results.brief_description: If you must brand, brand as lightly and as small as possible - this Wool Board film shows the woolgrower the financial loss caused, and the damage done to Australian-grown wool by the practice of branding sheep, stressing that the extra costs involved in removing brands before the wool is manufactured into cloth are inevitably passed back to growers and to the public. Narrated by Keith Eden.

results.title: Branded Si-Ro-Mark
results.creator_credit: Australian Wool Board and Frank Land
results.brief_description: Each year, great damage is done to the Australian wool clip by branding fluids. At wool sales, the price for marked wool decreases and in scouring and milling processes later, it is impossible to remove all the dirty wool, resulting in the needless waste of finished woollen goods. The CSIRO has developed an accurable and permanent branding fluid, “Si-Ro-Mark” and its wide-spread use to replace tar, sump-oil and other unsatisfactory fluids is advocated, not only in the interests of the grower but also the Australian wool and woollen textile industry as a whole.

results.title: Brand new key
results.brief_description: A lively animation based on Melanie’s popular song, finds the female lead skating into her boyfriends affections. A short, amusing film with uncluttered animation. Title song sung by Cher.
